memberdef.argsstring: (size_t t, size_t h, size_t g, size_t H, size_t G)
memberdef.name: param_index

memberdef.argsstring: (size_t t, size_t h, size_t d, size_t H, size_t D)
memberdef.name: payload_index

briefdescription.para: Validate options and populate derived fields in kv (no allocation).

simplesect.para: 0 on success; non-zero on bad options.

briefdescription.para: Return the element size (in bytes) of the configured storage.

simplesect.para: Size in bytes of one element in K/V buffers.

briefdescription.para: Initialize a KV cache with the given options and allocate backing memory.

detaileddescription.para: On success, the cache owns all internal buffers and must be released with ie_kv_free(). All buffers are zero-initialized.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to an uninitialized cache handle (output).
Options controlling shape and storage policy.

simplesect.para: 0 on success; non-zero on bad arguments or allocation failure.

briefdescription.para: Free all resources owned by a KV cache.

detaileddescription.para: It is safe to call with a NULL pointer or with a partially initialized handle.

memberdef.argsstring: (ie_kv_cache *kv, size_t t, const float *K_f32, const float *V_f32)
memberdef.name: ie_kv_store_token_f32

briefdescription.para: Store one token’s worth of K/V rows provided in FP32 into the cache.

detaileddescription.para: The input slices must be contiguous and laid out as [heads, head_dim]. This function requires storage == IE_KV_STORAGE_F32.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to input K slice (length heads*head_dim).
Pointer to input V slice (length heads*head_dim).

simplesect.para: 0 on success; non-zero on errors or type mismatch.

memberdef.argsstring: (ie_kv_cache *kv, size_t t, const float *K_f32, const float *V_f32)
memberdef.name: ie_kv_store_token_int8_per_tensor

briefdescription.para: Store one token’s K/V using INT8 per-tensor parameters (one scale/zp per head).

detaileddescription.para: For each head, parameters are derived from the K (or V) slice’s min/max and recorded with the payload. Requires storage == IE_KV_STORAGE_INT8 and uses kv->symmetric to choose symmetric/asymmetric mapping.

simplesect.para: 0 on success; non-zero on errors or type mismatch.

memberdef.argsstring: (ie_kv_cache *kv, size_t t, const float *K_f32, const float *V_f32)
memberdef.name: ie_kv_store_token_int8_per_group

briefdescription.para: Store one token’s K/V using INT8 per-group parameters along head_dim.

detaileddescription.para: Groups have size kv->group_size; parameters are computed and stored for each (token, head, group). Requires storage == IE_KV_STORAGE_INT8.

simplesect.para: 0 on success; non-zero on errors or type mismatch.

memberdef.argsstring: (ie_kv_cache *kv, size_t t, const float *K_f32, const float *V_f32)
memberdef.name: ie_kv_store_token_fp8

briefdescription.para: Store one token’s K/V as FP8 (E4M3/E5M2), no scale arrays.

detaileddescription.para: Uses kv->fp8_format for encoding. Requires storage == IE_KV_STORAGE_FP8.

simplesect.para: 0 on success; non-zero on errors or type mismatch.

briefdescription.para: Load one token’s K/V as FP32, dequantizing/decoding if needed.

detaileddescription.para: The output buffers must have length heads*head_dim. Works with any storage kind and performs the appropriate conversion on the fly.

simplesect.para: 0 on success; non-zero on errors or bounds/type mismatch.

briefdescription.para: Return raw pointers to the internal K/V payloads and the logical stride.

detaileddescription.para: This is a convenience for custom kernels that want to access the backing arrays directly. The logical leading dimension along D is head_dim.

parameterdescription.para: Output pointer to the base of K buffer (may be NULL).
Output pointer to the base of V buffer (may be NULL).

simplesect.para: 0 on success; non-zero on bad arguments.

briefdescription.para: Implementation of a compact Key/Value attention cache with INT8/FP8 compression.

detaileddescription.para: The cache stores per-token K/V slices laid out as [heads, head_dim] per token, flattened with head_dim as the fastest-varying dimension:
For INT8 storage, per-group affine parameters are kept for each (token, head). The parameter array index is:
This file contains no dynamic threading or allocator hooks; callers control parallelism outside and provide FP32 views on demand via ie_kv_load_token_f32.
